page.title: 09THE HISTORY OF CANNON HALL.
page.content: Cannon Hall has now been turned into a museum. It was first owned in 1086 by a saxon, Ailric, under the lordship of Ilbert de Lacy. At the end of the thirteenth century it was owned by a family called Canum, from where the hall got its name. Then between the years 1342 and 1382 it was sold to the Basvilles of Ardsley. In 1650 the estate was bought by Robert Hartley a yeoman, he died in 1656 and left it to his daughter Margaret but her mother's second husband called John Spencer bought it afew years later. When John Spencer's grandson died in 1756 the property was bequeathed to his heir. Cannon Hall is characteristic example of the lesser country house of the Georgian age built in sandstone. It was bought by the county borough of Barnsley in 1951, and left family
